privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.acknowledgment: Common Seas ("us", "we", or "our") operates the www.plasticcleverschools.org and www.plasticcleverschools.co.uk websites (hereinafter referred to as the "Service").
privacy.acknowledgment_message: We use your data to provide and improve the Service. By using the Service, you agree to the collection and use of information in accordance with this policy.

introduction.title: Definitions
introduction.paragraph1: This page informs you of our policies regarding the collection, use and disclosure of personal data when you use our Service and the choices you have associated with that data.
introduction.paragraph2: Unless otherwise defined in this Privacy Policy, the terms used in this Privacy Policy have the same meanings as in our Terms and Conditions, accessible from https://commonseas.com

subsection1_1.title: Service
subsection1_1.intro: Service includes the www.plasticcleverschools.org and www.plasticcleverschools.co.uk websites operated by Common Seas and other services we provide.

subsection1_2.title: Personal Data
subsection1_2.intro: Personal Data means data about a living individual who can be identified from those data (or from those and other information either in our possession or likely to come into our possession).

subsection1_3.title: Usage Data
subsection1_3.intro: Usage Data is data collected automatically either generated by the use of the Service or from the Service infrastructure itself (for example, the duration of a page visit).

subsection1_4.title: Cookies
subsection1_4.intro: Cookies are small files stored on your device (computer or mobile device).

section2.title: Information Collection and Use
section2.intro: We collect several different types of information for various purposes to provide and improve our Service to you.
items: Email address
Cookies and Usage Data

We may use your Personal Data to contact you with newsletters, marketing or promotional materials and other information that may be of interest to you. You may opt out of receiving any, or all, of these communications from us by following the unsubscribe link or the instructions provided in any email we send.

section3.title: School Data
section3.intro: If you choose to register for Plastic Clever Schools, we will ask you to provide contact details and statistical information about your school and its pupils as part of the registration process, and you will be able to supply further information as 'evidence' as your school completes the three stages of the award.
items: Before evidence can be uploaded, you will be asked to supply a consent letter confirming that the school has the necessary parental consent to share photographs of the children whose images are uploaded.

subsection4_1.title: Usage Data
subsection4_1.content: We may also collect information on how the Service is accessed and used ("Usage Data"). This Usage Data may include information such as your computer's Internet Protocol address (e.g. IP address), browser type, browser version, the pages of our Service that you visit, the time and date of your visit, the time spent on those pages, unique device identifiers and other diagnostic data.

subsection4_2.title: Tracking Cookies Data
subsection4_2.intro: We use cookies and similar tracking technologies to track the activity on our Service and we hold certain information. You can instruct your browser to refuse all cookies or to indicate when a cookie is being sent. However, if you do not accept cookies, you may not be able to use some portions of our Service.
items: Session Cookies: We use Session Cookies to operate our Service
Preference Cookies: We use Preference Cookies to remember your preferences and various settings
Security Cookies: We use Security Cookies for security purposes
subsection4_2.outro: Cookies are files with a small amount of data which may include an anonymous unique identifier. Cookies are sent to your browser from a website and stored on your device. Other tracking technologies are also used such as beacons, tags and scripts to collect and track information and to improve and analyse our Service.

subsection4_3.title: Children's Privacy
subsection4_3.content: Our Service collects photographs as part of schools' evidence submissions for the Plastic Clever Schools Award. These photos may include photos of children under the age of 18. These photos are provided by the children's schools and are stored securely with the informed consent of the schools. Under GDPR, photographs are considered personal data.

subsection4_4.title: Use of Images
subsection4_4.content: Where schools have provided a signed letter confirming consent has been given for publication of images of pupils, they are published on www.plasticcleverschools.org. These photos may be used by Common Seas and its partners, Kids Against Plastic, and River Clean-up to promote Plastic Clever Schools and the Plastic Clever Schools Award. In accordance with GDPR, on request, these images will be removed from the website, any corresponding databases, and future printed publications.

section5.title: Use of Data
section5.intro: Common Seas uses the collected data for various purposes:
items: To provide and maintain our Service
To notify you about changes to our Service
To allow you to participate in interactive features of our Service when you choose to do so
To provide customer support
To gather analysis or valuable information so that we can improve our Service
To monitor the usage of our Service
To detect, prevent and address technical issues

To provide you with news, special offers and general information about other goods, services and events which we offer that are similar to those that you have already purchased or enquired about unless you have opted not to receive such information
section5.outro: Beyond the photographs described above, we do not knowingly collect personally identifiable information from anyone under the age of 18. If you are a parent or guardian and you are aware that your child has provided us with Personal Data, please contact us. If we become aware that we have collected Personal Data from children without verification of parental consent, we take steps to remove that information from our servers.

section6.title: Legal Basis for Processing Personal Data under GDPR
section6.intro: If you are from the European Economic Area (EEA), Common Seas' legal basis for collecting and using the personal information described in this Privacy Policy depends on the Personal Data we collect and the specific context in which we collect it. Common Seas may process your Personal Data because:
items: We need to perform a contract with you
You have given us permission to do so
The processing is in our legitimate interests and it is not overridden by your rights
To comply with the law

section7.title: Retention of Data
section7.intro: Common Seas will retain your Personal Data only for as long as is necessary for the purposes set out in this Privacy Policy. We will retain and use your Personal Data to the extent necessary to comply with our legal obligations, resolve disputes and enforce our legal agreements and policies.
items: Common Seas will also retain Usage Data for internal analysis purposes. Usage Data is generally retained for a shorter period of time, except when this data is used to strengthen the security or to improve the functionality of our Service, or we are legally obligated to retain this data for longer periods.

section8.title: Transfer of Data
section8.intro: Your information, including Personal Data, may be transferred to ‚Äì and maintained on ‚Äì computers located outside of your state, province, country or other governmental jurisdiction where the data protection laws may differ from those of your jurisdiction.
items: If you are located outside United Kingdom and choose to provide information to us, please note that we transfer the data, including Personal Data, to United Kingdom and process it there.
Your consent to this Privacy Policy followed by your submission of such information represents your agreement to that transfer.

Common Seas will take all the steps reasonably necessary to ensure that your data is treated securely and in accordance with this Privacy Policy and no transfer of your Personal Data will take place to an organisation or a country unless there are adequate controls in place including the security of your data and other personal information.

section9.title: Disclosure of Data
section9.paragraph1: Under certain circumstances, Common Seas may be required to disclose your Personal Data if required to do so by law or in response to valid requests by public authorities (e.g. a court or a government agency).
section9.paragraph2: Common Seas may disclose your Personal Data in the good faith belief that such action is necessary to:
items: To comply with a legal obligation
To protect and defend the rights or property of Common Seas
To prevent or investigate possible wrongdoing in connection with the Service
To protect the personal safety of users of the Service or the public
To protect against legal liability

section10.title: Security of Data
section10.paragraph1: The security of your data is important to us but remember that no method of transmission over the Internet or method of electronic storage is 100% secure. While we strive to use commercially acceptable means to protect your Personal Data, we cannot guarantee its absolute security.

section11.title: Your Data Protection Rights under GDPR
section11.paragraph1: If you are a resident of the European Economic Area (EEA), you have certain data protection rights. Common Seas aims to take reasonable steps to allow you to correct, amend, delete or limit the use of your Personal Data.
section11.paragraph2: If you wish to be informed about what Personal Data we hold about you and if you want it to be removed from our systems, please contact us. In certain circumstances, you have the following data protection rights:

section12.title: Your Rights
section12.paragraph1: You have the right to access, update or delete the information we have on you. Whenever made possible, you can access, update or request deletion of your Personal Data directly within your account settings section. If you are unable to perform these actions yourself, please contact us to assist you.
items: The right of rectification. You have the right to have your information rectified if that information is inaccurate or incomplete.
The right to object. You have the right to object to our processing of your Personal Data.
The right of restriction. You have the right to request that we restrict the processing of your personal information.
The right to data portability. You have the right to be provided with a copy of the information we have on you in a structured, machine-readable and commonly used format.
The right to withdraw consent. You also have the right to withdraw your consent at any time where Common Seas relied on your consent to process your personal information.
section12.paragraph3: Please note that we may ask you to verify your identity before responding to such requests. You have the right to complain to a Data Protection Authority about our collection and use of your Personal Data. For more information, please contact your local data protection authority in the European Economic Area (EEA).

section13.title: Service Providers and Analytics
section13.intro: We may employ third party companies and individuals to facilitate our Service ("Service Providers"), provide the Service on our behalf, perform Service-related services or assist us in analysing how our Service is used. These third parties have access to your Personal Data only to perform these tasks on our behalf and are obligated not to disclose or use it for any other purpose.
section13.contact_subtitle: Google Analytics is a web analytics service offered by Google that tracks and reports website traffic. Google uses the data collected to track and monitor the use of our Service. This data is shared with other Google services. Google may use the collected data to contextualise and personalise the ads of its own advertising network.
section13.contact_email_label: You can opt-out of having made your activity on the Service available to Google Analytics by installing the Google Analytics opt-out browser add-on. The add-on prevents the Google Analytics JavaScript (ga.js, analytics.js and dc.js) from sharing information with Google Analytics about visits activity.
section13.contact_email_privacy: For more information on the privacy practices of Google, please visit the Google Privacy Terms web page: https://policies.google.com/privacy?hl=en
section13.contact_email_general: Our Service may contain links to other sites that are not operated by us. If you click a third party link, you will be directed to that third party's site. We strongly advise you to review the Privacy Policy of every site you visit. We have no control over and assume no responsibility for the content, privacy policies or practices of any third party sites or services.
section13.contact_website: We may update our Privacy Policy from time to time. We will notify you of any changes by posting the new Privacy Policy on this page and will inform users of the Service via a notification in the 'Dashboard' portal, prior to the change becoming effective and update the "effective date" at the top of this Privacy Policy. You are advised to review this Privacy Policy periodically for any changes. Changes to this Privacy Policy are effective when they are posted on this page.
section13.outro: We operate in accordance with all relevant UK data protection laws. If you would like to find out more beyond the details in this policy, please visit the Information Commissioner's website www.ico.org.uk If you have any questions about this Privacy Policy or would like to make a complaint about how we have managed your data, please contact us by email: education@commonseas.com

introduction.title: Introduction
introduction.paragraph1: Welcome to Plastic Clever Schools ("we," "our," or "us"). These Terms and Conditions govern your use of the Plastic Clever Schools platform and services. By accessing or using our platform, you agree to be bound by these terms.
introduction.paragraph2: Plastic Clever Schools is a global initiative managed by Common Seas in partnership with Kids Against Plastic, designed to help schools reduce single-use plastic and educate students about environmental responsibility.

section1.title: 1. Acceptance of Terms
section1.intro: By registering your school or creating an account on the Plastic Clever Schools platform, you confirm that:
items: You are authorized to represent your educational institution
You are at least 18 years of age or have obtained parental/guardian consent
You agree to comply with all applicable laws and regulations
All information provided during registration is accurate and current

subsection2_1.title: 2.1 Account Security
subsection2_1.content: You are responsible for maintaining the confidentiality of your account credentials and for all activities that occur under your account. You must notify us immediately of any unauthorized access or security breaches.

subsection2_2.title: 2.2 School Roles
subsection2_2.intro: Our platform supports multiple user roles within schools:
items: Head Teacher: Full administrative access to school account, team management, and evidence approval
Teacher: Ability to submit evidence, view resources, and participate in school activities
Pending Teacher: Limited access pending verification by head teacher

subsection2_3.title: 2.3 Acceptable Use
items: Upload false, misleading, or fraudulent evidence
Impersonate another school, teacher, or organisation
Use the platform for commercial purposes without authorization
Interfere with the security or operation of the platform
Upload content that infringes intellectual property rights
Share inappropriate, offensive, or harmful content

subsection3_1.title: 3.1 Three-Stage Journey
subsection3_1.content: The Plastic Clever Schools programme consists of three stages: Inspire, Investigate, and Act. Schools must complete evidence requirements for each stage in order to progress.

subsection3_2.title: 3.2 Evidence Submission
items: Original work created by your school community
Accurate and truthful representations of your activities
Compliant with student privacy and data protection regulations
Free from copyrighted material unless you have permission to use it

subsection3_3.title: 3.3 Evidence Review
subsection3_3.content: We reserve the right to review, approve, or reject any evidence submissions. Rejected evidence will include feedback for improvement. Schools may resubmit evidence after addressing feedback.

subsection3_4.title: 3.4 Award Recognition
subsection3_4.content: Schools that complete all three stages will receive Plastic Clever Schools recognition. We reserve the right to revoke recognition if evidence is found to be fraudulent or if schools violate these terms.

subsection4_1.title: 4.1 Your Content
subsection4_1.intro: You retain ownership of all content you upload to the platform (photos, videos, documents, etc.). By submitting content, you grant us a non-exclusive, worldwide, royalty-free license to use, display, and distribute your content for the purposes of:
items: Operating and improving the Plastic Clever Schools platform
Showcasing school achievements in our inspiration gallery
Promoting the programme in marketing materials (with your school's consent)
Creating case studies to inspire other schools

subsection4_2.title: 4.2 Our Content
subsection4_2.content: All platform content, including resources, educational materials, logos, and branding, is owned by Common Seas and its partners. You may use these materials for educational purposes within your school but may not reproduce, distribute, or commercialize them without permission.

subsection4_3.title: 4.3 Student Privacy
subsection4_3.content: When submitting photos or videos featuring students, you confirm that you have obtained appropriate consent from parents/guardians and comply with all applicable data protection laws (including GDPR, COPPA, etc.).

We are committed to protecting student privacy and complying with all applicable data protection regulations.

items: You violate these Terms and Conditions
You submit fraudulent or misleading evidence
Your account is inactive for an extended period
We discontinue the service (with reasonable notice)
section6.outro: You may request account deletion at any time by contacting us. Upon deletion, your evidence submissions and school data will be removed, though anonymized data may be retained for statistical purposes.
